00048 class KVILIB_API KviConfigurationFile : public KviHeapObject
00049 {
00050 public:
00051         enum FileMode { Read = 1, Write = 2, ReadWrite = 3 };
00052 public:
00053         KviConfigurationFile(const QString &filename,FileMode f/* = ReadWrite*/,bool bLocal8Bit = false);
00054         KviConfigurationFile(const char *filename,FileMode f/* = ReadWrite*/,bool bLocal8Bit = false);
00055         ~KviConfigurationFile();
00056 private:
00057         bool                         m_bLocal8Bit;
00058         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviConfigurationFileGroup>      * m_pDict;
00059         QString                      m_szFileName;
00060         bool                         m_bDirty;
00061         QString                      m_szStrBuffer;
00062         QString                      m_szGroup;
00063         bool                         m_bPreserveEmptyGroups;
00064         bool                         m_bReadOnly;
00065 private:
00066         bool load();
00067         bool save();
00068         KviConfigurationFileGroup * getCurrentGroup();
00069 public:
00070         //
00071         // Useful when saving...
00072         // Normally this class does not save empty groups
00073         // and setGroup() is never a config modification.
00074         // If the group is not existing it will be effectively
00075         // created only at the first attempt to read from it or write to it.
00076         // With this flag set to true the KviConfigurationFile class will
00077         // write down also the empty groups, and calls to setGroup()
00078         // will create the groups if not existing yet (and set the config data
00079         // as modified).
00080         //
00081         void preserveEmptyGroups(bool bPreserve){ m_bPreserveEmptyGroups = bPreserve; };
00082         const QString & fileName(){ return m_szFileName; };
00083         bool readOnly(){ return m_bReadOnly; };
00084         void setReadOnly(bool bReadOnly){ m_bReadOnly = bReadOnly; };
00085         bool dirty(){ return m_bDirty; };
00086         bool ensureWritable();
00087         //
00088         // This sets the save path for the config file
00089         // In this way you can load a system-wide read-only config file
00090         // as default configuration, alter its settings and save it to the
00091         // user local configuration directory
00092         void setSavePath(const QString & savePath){ m_szFileName = savePath; };
00093         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviConfigurationFileGroup> *dict(){ return m_pDict; };
00094 
00095         void clearDirtyFlag(){ m_bDirty = false; };
00096         void clear();
00097         void clearGroup(const QString & szGroup);
00098         void clearKey(const QString & szKey);
00099         unsigned int groupsCount(){ return m_pDict->count(); };
00100         bool sync(){ return save(); };
00101         bool hasKey(const QString & szKey);
00102         bool hasGroup(const QString & szGroup);
00103         void setGroup(const QString & szGroup);
00104         //void getContentsString(KviCString &buffer);
00105         const QString & group(){ return m_szGroup; };
00106         void writeEntry(const QString & szKey,const QString & szValue);
00107         void writeEntry(const QString & szKey,const char * szValue)
00108                 { writeEntry(szKey,QString::fromUtf8(szValue)); };
00109         QString readEntry(const QString & szKey,const QString & szDefault = QString());
00110         // HACK for KviOptions.. (FIXME)
00111         QString readKviCStringEntry(const QString &szKey,const KviCString &szDefault)
00112                 { return readEntry(szKey,szDefault.ptr()); };

00149 #ifdef COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS
00150         // On windows we need to override new and delete operators
00151         // to ensure that always the right new/delete pair is called for an object instance
00152         // This bug is present in all the classes exported by a module that
00153         // can be instantiated/destroyed from external modules.
00154         // (this is a well known bug described in Q122675 of MSDN)
00155         void       * operator new(size_t tSize);
00156         void         operator delete(void * p);
00157 #endif
